isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 25-SI SERIES, TYPES 400 AND 450 - REPAIR PROCEDURES - DIODE REPLACEMENT

svcsubproc.title: Replacing a Diode In The Rectifier End Frame

step1.para: Separate the rectifier end frame from the drive end frame.
Remove the heat sink from the end frame by detaching from the heat sink the regulator lead, the heat sink mounting screws and the alternator output terminal.

important.para: Note the round insulators under the heat sink mounting screws and the flat insulator located behind the heat sink. The silicone grease on both sides of the flat insulator provides the necessary heat transfer between heat sink and end frame. Re-apply silicone grease to both sides of the flat insulator during assembly.

step1.para: Use a suitable tool to pull the diode out of the end frame.
Use a suitable tool which fits over the outer diode edge to push the diode in, and support the end frame with a suitable tool.

note.para: Diode replacement tools are available from various manufacturers normally supplying tools and test equipment to the automotive industry.

caution.para: Do not strike the diode as the shock may damage it and the other diodes. Use only those diodes listed in the parts list for these units. Never use substitutes.

step1.para: Tighten heat sink mounting screws loosely, securely tighten output terminal, then securely tighten the heat sink screws.

svcsubproc.title: Replacing a Diode In the Heat Sink

step1.para: Separate the rectifier end frame from the drive end frame.
Remove the heat sink from the end frame by detaching from the heat sink the regulator lead, the heat sink mounting screws and the generator output terminal.
Support heat sink and use an arbor press or vise to push the diode out.
Use a suitable tool which fits over the outer diode edge to push the diode in. Support the heat sink with a suitable tool.

note.para: Diode replacement tools are available from various manufacturers normally supplying tools and test equipment to the automotive industry.

caution.para: Do not strike the diode as the shock may damage it and the other diodes. Use only those diodes listed in the parts list for these units. Never use substitutes.
